com.is2t.mwt.composites
Class BorderComposite

java.lang.Object
  ej.mwt.Widget
      ej.mwt.Composite
          com.is2t.mwt.composites.BorderComposite
All Implemented Interfaces:
ej.mwt.Renderable
public class BorderComposite
extends ej.mwt.Composite

A border composite is a Composite that lays out its children in five regions: MWT.NORTH, MWT.SOUTH, MWT.EAST, MWT.WEST, MWT.CENTER. Each region can contain at most one widget.

horizontal

protected final boolean horizontal

Constructor Detail

BorderComposite

public BorderComposite()
Creates a new border composite.
Identical to calling BorderComposite(int) with MWT.HORIZONTAL as direction.

BorderComposite

public BorderComposite(int direction)
Creates a new border composite specifying the direction.
The direction can be MWT.HORIZONTAL or MWT.VERTICAL. Respectively, the children will be laid out in three rows (NORTH, {WEST CENTER EAST}, SOUTH) or in three columns (WEST, {NORTH CENTER SOUTH}, EAST).

Parameters:
direction - the direction of the layout priority
Since:
1.0

BorderComposite

public BorderComposite(int x,
                       int y,
                       int width,
                       int height)
Deprecated. use BorderComposite() and Widget.setBounds(int, int, int, int)

Creates a new border composite specifying its bounds. Its position is relative to the position of its parent.

Parameters:
x - the relative x coordinate of the composite
y - the relative y coordinate of the composite
width - the width of the composite
height - the height of the composite
Method Detail

validate

public void validate(int widthHint,
                     int heightHint)

Lays out children to fit five regions: MWT.NORTH, MWT.SOUTH, MWT.EAST, MWT.WEST , MWT.CENTER.

The parameters define the maximum size available for this composite, or MWT.NONE if there is no constraint.
After this call the preferred size will have been established.

Specified by:
validate in class ej.mwt.Composite
Parameters:
widthHint - the width available for this widget or MWT.NONE
heightHint - the height available for this widget or MWT.NONE

add

public void add(ej.mwt.Widget widget)
Adds the specified widget at the MWT.CENTER position of this composite. Identical to addAt(widget, MWT.CENTER).

Overrides:
add in class ej.mwt.Composite
Parameters:
widget - the widget to add
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified widget is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified widget or one of its children is already connected to a Panel

addAt

public void addAt(ej.mwt.Widget widget,
                  int position)
Adds the specified widget at the specified position in the composite. If there is already a widget at this position, it is removed from the composite.

Parameters:
widget - the widget to add
position - the position in the composite
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified widget is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified widget or one of its children is already connected to a Panel
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified position is not one of MWT.NORTH, MWT.SOUTH, MWT.WEST, MWT.EAST, MWT.CENTER

removeAt

public void removeAt(int position)

Removes the widget at the specified position from the list of children of this composite.
If there is no widget at this position in the composite, nothing is done.

Parameters:
position - the position of the widget to remove
